private_information: I can only pick up and move blocks whose labels are vowels: A, E, I.
I can only interact with blocks that are at the top of a stack.
I can move one block at a time and place it either on the table or on top of another top block.
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks to reach the target stacking configuration provided by the orchestrator.

private_information: I can only pick up and move blocks whose labels are consonants: B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K.
I can only interact with blocks that are at the top of a stack.
I can move one block at a time and place it either on the table or on top of another top block.
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks to reach the target stacking configuration provided by the orchestrator.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and integrate their capability reports into a complete plan.
I will produce a final PDDL domain and problem intended for the FastDownward solver.
orchestrator.goal: Achieve the final stacking where A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, and K is on the table.

public_information: There are uniquely labelled blocks: I, C, G, J, A, E, H, K, D, F, B.
Rules: agents can only move the top block of any stack and move one block at a time.
Vowel agent is restricted to vowel blocks and consonant agent is restricted to consonant blocks.
Initial configuration: I is on the table.
Initial configuration: C is on the table.
Initial configuration: G is on top of C.
Initial configuration: J is on top of I.
Initial configuration: A is on top of J.
Initial configuration: E is on top of A.
Initial configuration: H is on top of G.
Initial configuration: K is on top of H.
Initial configuration: D is on top of K.
Initial configuration: F is on top of E.
Initial configuration: B is on top of D.
Goal configuration: A is on top of B.
Goal configuration: B is on top of C.
Goal configuration: C is on top of D.
Goal configuration: D is on top of E.
Goal configuration: E is on top of F.
Goal configuration: F is on top of G.
Goal configuration: G is on top of H.
Goal configuration: H is on top of I.
Goal configuration: I is on top of J.
Goal configuration: J is on top of K.
Goal configuration: K is on the table.

analysis.system_prompt: You are the vowel_agent. Provide a clear capability report about what you can do in the block rearrangement task. Do not produce PDDL. Describe the set of vowel blocks you can move, the preconditions for your moves, the effects of your moves, and any sequencing or resource constraints you perceive. If some information is missing, state the assumptions you would need to make.
analysis.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. Here is the public information available: {environment->public_information}. Here is your private information: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Your objective is: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Produce a capability report that includes: a) a concise list of blocks you can move, b) the allowed move types, c) preconditions and effects of your move operations expressed in plain text, d) any conflicts with the other agent you anticipate, and e) a short suggested sequence of natural-language moves you can perform without requiring the other agent to move consonant blocks.

analysis.system_prompt: You are the consonant_agent. Provide a clear capability report about what you can do in the block rearrangement task. Do not produce PDDL. Describe the set of consonant blocks you can move, the preconditions for your moves, the effects of your moves, and any sequencing or resource constraints you perceive. If some information is missing, state the assumptions you would need to make.
analysis.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. Here is the public information available: {environment->public_information}. Here is your private information: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Your objective is: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Produce a capability report that includes: a) a concise list of blocks you can move, b) the allowed move types, c) preconditions and effects of your move operations expressed in plain text, d) any conflicts with the other agent you anticipate, and e) a short suggested sequence of natural-language moves you can perform without requiring the vowel agent to move vowel blocks.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the capability reports from the two agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for solving with the FastDownward planner. You must enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Include the :requirements, :predicates, agent-distinct actions, and any typing necessary. Keep the actions of the two agents distinct by prefixing or encoding agent identity in action names or parameters. Ensure the produced PDDL correctly models the initial configuration and the goal configuration specified in the public information. Target FastDownward by including common requirements compatible with it.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Here are the capability reports from the agents: {vowel_report} {consonant_report}. Your task is to produce a finalized PDDL domain and PDDL problem that implement the block moving domain with two agents whose actions remain distinguishable. The domain should model that only top blocks can be moved, only one block at a time can be moved, and each agent can only move their allowed letters (vowels or consonants). The problem should encode the given initial state and the goal state. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. The output will be consumed by FastDownward.
